author: bmwlego
title: Build Your Own Minifigs, Play as Most Characters, Control Vehicles and Wield a Light Saber!
review: I loved playing this game. I am more familiar with the original trilogy so when LEGO Star Wars I was released I was upset it was based on the 2nd Trilogy (I, II and III). When I found out that this game was made, I couldn't wait to play it. It doesn't disappoint. The cut scenes are spectacular and you feel as if you were watching a Star Wars movie made from LEGO. The vehicles you can control are a lot of fun and you can even customize a minifig character to play as. As with the Star Wars films, the music is great as is the story line. I love this game and can't wait for the LEGO Batman license to get the same treatment. At 20 bucks you can't go wrong...unless you buy the Complete Trilogy that combines both games 1 and 2 into 1 game with added levels, features and characters.

author: tauntaunwampa
title: Impressive, Most Impressive
review:
THis is the best game LEGO has made, much improved from the first and i don't know about the complete saga. Since it took me a long time to write the first one i'll use Cons and Pros.
PROS
Charaters different, cool, better detail
Can climb in to vechiles 
Mix and match characters
extras
CONS
none

A really good gaem reccomended for everyone.

author: lego_anakin
title: The Original Trilogy of Star Wars is Finially Out In Lego On Consoles
review: I got this game from Play.com for £14.99 You can battle through the original trilogy with Lego Star Wars 2 The Original Trilogy, There are 68 characters to unlock exept Princess Leia and Captain Antilles obviously.I got the Playstation 2 version of the game,there are 99 lego gold bricks to collect in the game and to have access to the bonus levels of episodes 4 to 6 you have to complete all the levels in the episode and collect the right amount of gold bricks needed to make the door. Once completed you can build a gold door which has 3 levels inside  it,but the minikit bonus is locked.If you have collected all ten minikits in one level before having access to the secret door then the minikit level is avallable.You also have the abillity to mix and match characters in a funny tube like thing ,I also have this game on Nintendo Ds  and the Playstation Portable,this is an brilliant game and all the humour and fun is fab don,t miss out on buying it.It is a must have for any Lego Star Wars Fan and also if you enter two secret cheat codes then you will have the abillity to create santa clause in mix and match

author: Matt_Vader
title: Lego Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy Video Game
review:
Addictive and Fun Game
But Quite Short and Gets BORING Somtimes
Your Base is The Cantina and a good thing is if you kill a Citizen everyone start shootin' you. Outside you can view your minikits.

Levels
Episode IV: A New Hope
Secret Plans 
Through the Jundland Wastes
Mos Eisley Spaceport
Rescue The Princess
Escape from the Death Star
Rebel Attack

Pros-
Go Inside the Sandcrawler in Through the Jundland Wastes
Defeat The Impierial Spy

Cons-
None

Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back
Hoth Battle
Escape from Echo Base
Falcon Flight
Dagobah
Trap For Luke
Betrayal over Bespin

Pros-
Use Harpoon in Hoth Battle

Cons-
Dagobah is BORING

Episode VI: Return of The Jedi
Jabba's Palace
The Great Pit of Carkoon
Speeder Showdown
Battle of Endor
Jedi Destiny
Into the Death Star

Pros-
You Destroy star Destroyers in Into the Death Star
Funny Cut Scene in The Great Pit of Carkoon

Cons-
You Destroy too Many speeders in Speeder Showdown

Get it if 
You Want a Action packed game

Don't get it if
you want a Longer Game

Overall Rating
10/10

author: donneyboy
title: best game ever
review:
i got this game for Christmas and i love it! the best part is you can create custom  characters for example take Han solo legs( with holster),c-3po torso, red lightsabre, and Darth Vader head and you got Darth Han 3po. another sweet thing is you can build and ride vehicles. and if you get 60 gold bricks you can build a lego city.

pros- character customizer 
build and ride vehicles
play through all 3 movies
movie clips in lego
double score zone

cons- none!

author: DarthVader_
title: Awesome!
review: The game is awesome and all the games are all awesome.  The only thing that I don't like about it, is that it is HARD! The characters are awesome and I like how you can ride in classic vehicles and make new characters! In all, I give it a 4/5!

author: hustla187
title: Nice Game
review: Lego and Tt Games did a great job on this game. I like the idea of making your own minifigs to be in the game and some of the minifigs that haven't been released yet. The levels are great and covers the original trilogy and is a really good game. 5 out of 5.

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: Great Shot, Kid!
review:
An extremely, fantastically, amazingly well designed game, you will never get bored (well, maybe sometimes). 

Pros:
X-Treme lightsaber actions by Master Yoda and Darth Sidious
Nicely designed Mos Eisley Spaceport
Excellent graphic and sound
Very close with the film in songs (for example you will find the same music played inside Mos Eisley both in the game and in the film)
Funny Chewbacca

Cons:
None!

Very good game, and I wish the Force will be with you.

The Force will be with us,
Felix

review: i loved this game all the way through. it was amazing. the character creation was a new feature but it was a bit dissapointing. not all of the parts are available like bobas jet pack which i really wanted. totally new levels. good game.

author: Legonat
title: The best LEGO game so far!
review:
• This game is the best so far.

            Pros

            All the Characters, Vehicles, and Scenes from A New Hope, The Empire Strikes   
            Back, and Return Of The Jedi,

            You can make custom and unique characters,

            Use special moves unique to each character,

            If you have LEGO Star Wars the videogame, You can use extra toggle to unlock
            all your old characters,

            Drop in/Drop out coop,

            Free play lets you be any character in any level


            Cons

            Some characters have not even been made into LEGO minifigs


            Overall a 5/5

author: Planetsbend
title: The Saga is now complete!
review: This is a great sequel to a great game. What's better about this one is the fact that it has more things to find in order to unlock more special features along with creating the same mini vehicles outside (which are cool to look at). I absolutely love how there is a lot more hours put into the game by the player and the idea of having to find more in order to get more. Get this game!

author: Odeinoichus
title: The Force will be With You, Always...
review:
LEGO Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy: This sequel to the first LEGO Star Wars game proved that LEGO Adventure Titles of this caliber had the staying power to create something vivid and intense. It also proved that combining LEGO and Star Wars together could be both humorous, ingenious and one of the better things of this new millennium.

 

The new features introduced in this game allowed you to create fun and quirky Mini-Figure characters for Free Play mode. They introduced the Mini-Kit Vehicle stages in which you got to actually use your Mini-Kits for something. The Bounty Hunter style missions, track down the characters wanted by Jabba the Hutt. Attain True Jeid status in both Story Mode and Free Play mode, something the original didn't have. Much better Vehicle stages with free roaming (to an extent) and larger arenas to play in that weren't simply on rails.

 

Many new fun Red Brick powers/Extras and of course the play through the entire Episode in one sitting to achieve the high score. The stages were slightly longer too if I recall and they offered up many more opportunities to build and interact with the LEGO Star Wars Universe. If not for LEGO Star Wars II's improvements I fear we wouldn't have gotten the great games that followed (LEGO Batman/LEGO Harry Potter/LEGO Indiana Jones) nor would we have even wanted them.

 

Lucasfilm, LEGO and Traveler's Tales have done something that has been tried before, but not always succeeded, they made great video games that were fun for the whole family. You could play along with your children and enjoy the video game experience alongside of them, helping them out with trickier puzzle like situations or even just letting you watch along as your kids discovered something new and exciting.

 

All in all I'd have to say that without LEGO Star Wars II the LEGO Video Game Franchise would be an entirely different creature and who knows what that creature might look like? The improvements to the overall feel and design of the game proved something. It proved that you could enjoy a great LEGO based game no matter what your age.

 

And by now I think I'm just repeating myself. I'd have to say that if you don't already own this game and are looking for a shorter adventure as opposed to LEGO Star Wars the Complete Saga for your children to sink their teeth into and start out with the LEGO Video Game franchise, I think this one is suitable for them. And in case you're wondering why I only rate the parts and building experience as one for these games, well the site doesn't give you an option to rate them as zero since they really don't apply for Video Games.

author: jedi_master_kit_fisto
title: excellent
review: it is a good game to play with because it has good levels and you can play as all the characters on episodes, 4 , 5 and 6. It's sort of real because you can drive and fly through space. you can build lots of things like buildings, ships, vehicles and tanks so overall it is a fun game to play!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: LEGO Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy
review: If you are a fan of LEGO or Star Wars in general, then this is the game for you. This is a game I love to play, it is an amazing game to own.
